com.persistit

Class Management.BufferInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.persistit.Management.AcquisitionTimeBase
      • com.persistit.Management.BufferInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Enclosing interface:
    Management

    public static class Management.BufferInfo
extends Management.AcquisitionTimeBase
implements Serializable

    Exposes information about one Buffer. Use the Management.getBufferInfoArray(int, int, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) method to get an array of BufferInfo s for Buffers in various states.

    Note that the content of a BufferPool and the status of individual Buffers changes extremely rapidly when Persistit is active. A BufferInfo represents a snapshot of this state at the acquisition time.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Returns:

        Return the index of this Buffer within the BufferPool array.
        Returns:

      • getType

        public int getType()
        Return the type of page occupying this Buffer as an integer. See getTypeName() for a displayable form.
        Returns:
        The type.

      • getTypeName

        public String getTypeName()
        Return the type of page occupying this Buffer in displayable name form. Values include 
         
    Unused
    Data
    IndexNN
    Garbage
    LongRecord
        where NN indicates index level counting from the leaf data page.
        Returns:
        The displayable page type

      • getStatus

        public int getStatus()
        Return the status integer for this Buffer. See getStatusName() for a displayable form.
        Returns:
        The status integer.

      • getStatusName

        public String getStatusName()
        Return the status of this Buffer in displayable form. Character flags in the string value include: 
           v - valid
   r - reader claim
   w - writer claim
   d - dirty
   nnn - count of threads with reader claims
        Returns:
        The status in displayable form

      • getWriterThreadName

        public String getWriterThreadName()
        Return the name of the Thread that currently holds a writer (exclusive) claim on the Buffer if there is one, otherwise returns null.
        Returns:
        The thread name, or null if there is none

        Returns:
        The page address.

        Returns:
        the volume ID

      • getTimestamp

        public long getTimestamp()
        Returns:
        the timestamp at which the page occupying this buffer was last changed.

      • getBufferSize

        public int getBufferSize()
        Returns:
        the buffer size, in bytes

      • getAvailableBytes

        public int getAvailableBytes()
        Returns:
        the number of unused bytes available to hold additional key/value pairs.

      • getAlloc

        public int getAlloc()
        Returns:
        he offset within the Buffer used internally in allocating space for key/value pairs.

      • getSlack

        public int getSlack()
        Returns:
        a size used internally in allocating space for key/value pairs.

      • getMvvCount

        public int getMvvCount()
        Returns:
        the approximate count of key/value pairs containing multi-version values.

      • getMvvSize

        public int getMvvSize()
        Returns:
        the approximate number of bytes consumed by multi-version values which are no longer visible to current transactions.

      • getKeyBlockStart

        public int getKeyBlockStart()
        Return an offset within the Buffer used internally in allocating space for key/value pairs.
        Returns:
        The keyBlockStart offset

      • getKeyBlockEnd

        Return an offset within the Buffer used internally in allocating space for key/value pairs.
        Returns:
        The keyBlockEnd offset

      • displayableSummary

        public String displayableSummary()
        Return a human-readable summary of information about the page contained in this Buffer.
        Returns:
